p: A large proportion of Zika, dengue, and chikungunya viral infections are asymptomatic [ 9– 11]. However, all three viruses are associated with moderate to severe health consequences in a small proportion of cases, with neonates, young children and/or older age groups at higher risk. Symptoms of Zika viral infection include rash, fever, arthralgia, and conjunctivitis [ 11]. More importantly, since its initial emergence in the Americas, Zika virus has been confirmed as a cause of congenital abnormalities (in infants born to women infected with Zika virus during pregnancy) and as a trigger of Guillain-Barré Syndrome [ 12]. Symptoms of dengue viral infection include rash, fever, arthralgia, and nausea. Some of the more severe symptoms of dengue viral infection may include deadly hemorrhage and plasma leak [ 9]. Symptoms of chikungunya viral infection include rash, fever, and arthralgia that may persist for an extended duration [ 7].
